intro: Neocussonia favargeri, commonly known as the favargeri's neocussonia, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and habitat loss.
